00001 /*
00002  * dirent.h
00003  */
00004 
00005 #ifndef _DIRENT_H
00006 #  define _DIRENT_H
00007 
00008 #  include <sys/types.h>
00009 #  include <limits.h>
00010 
00011 #define MAXNAMLEN   255 /* maximum filename length      */
00012 
00013 #ifndef NAME_MAX
00014 #define NAME_MAX    (MAXNAMLEN - 1)
00015 #endif
00016 
00017 struct dirent           /* data from getdents()/readdir()   */
00018 {
00019     ino_t   d_ino;      /* inode number of entry        */
00020     off_t   d_off;      /* offset of disk directory entry   */
00021     wchar_t d_reclen;   /* length of this record        */
00022     char    d_name[MAXNAMLEN + 1];
00023 };
00024 
00025 
00026 /* The following nonportable ugliness could have been avoided by defining
00027  * DIRENTSIZ and DIRENTBASESIZ to also have (struct dirent *) arguments.
00028  * There shouldn't be any problem if you avoid using the DIRENTSIZ() macro.
00029  */
00030 
00031 #define DIRENTBASESIZ       (((struct dirent *)0)->d_name \
00032                 - (char *)&((struct dirent *)0)->d_ino)
00033 
00034 #define DIRENTSIZ(namlen)   ((DIRENTBASESIZ + sizeof(long) + (namlen)) \
00035                 / sizeof(long) * sizeof(long))
00036 
00037 
00038 
00039 #  ifndef _BOOL_T_DEFINED
00040 typedef unsigned char   bool;
00041 #  define _BOOL_T_DEFINED
00042 #  endif
00043 
00044 #  define DIRBUF    8192    /* buffer size for fs-indep. dirs   */
00045                 /* must in general be larger than the   */
00046                 /* filesystem buffer size       */
00047 
00048 struct _dircontents {
00049     char        *_d_entry;
00050     struct _dircontents *_d_next;
00051 };
00052 
00053 typedef struct _dirdesc {
00054     int         dd_id;  /* uniquely identify each open directory */
00055     long        dd_loc; /* where we are in directory entry is this */
00056     struct _dircontents *dd_contents;   /* pointer to contents of dir   */
00057     struct _dircontents *dd_cp;     /* pointer to current position  */
00058 } DIR;

00066 #  undef  volatile
00067 #endif
